Despite the warnings people are still trying to park at Pitchcroft car park in #Worcester

#Worcester city centre where the Severn is at highest level since Feb 2014

Rising slowly. No significant problems in city but we’re monitoring closely with @myworcester @worcscc @WorcsTravel https://t.co/pztd7YDh1j
#Worcester is #open4business! The roads are open, the shops are open, the cafes are open! Don't let the high water levels put you off @WorcesterBID #WorcestershireHour https://t.co/pceTdRyAYL
Photo of the flood water taken from the top of our tower by Ringing Master Mark Regan at 10am today. The water is rising  but so far the floodplain is doing its job. https://t.co/G2VsFbVcyg
A busy sunny day in Worcester. Yes the river is somewhat larger than normal but please drive carefully and come into the city centre. We are open as usual. https://t.co/UEqv4T2WEZ
#Worcester racecourse https://t.co/pYeJUicobL
I've just emailed you, @walkerworcester - please can you make time to attend the #EnvironmentBill debate on MONDAY 28 OCT and speak up for wildlife and a #NatureRecoveryNetwork? Thank you

Just think, about half the @commonwealthsec is celebrating #Diwali2019 today. Even for those of us who don’t share the faith, it is a moment for us all to share what brings is together. #HappyDeepavali

Pitchcroft car park has started to flood. Please be aware that more water is due to arrive. Some cars already have water around them. Please retweet to try to contact the owners https://t.co/Rlf8tl6rYq
5 #flood warnings are in place for #Worcester https://t.co/XBUFQ6NIDW Thankfully no more rain is forecast for our area.

Worcester to London in under two hours - that’s the new quicker service on offer when the GWR timetable is launched later this year.

@WalkerWorcester @GWRHelp @HuddlestonNigel Agreed - and I will prove the old adage that success has many parents by thanking you for the name check, congratulating you and your fellow MPs - and feeling nostalgic about my overlapping decade of campaigning on the same issue!

The UK has moved up the rankings in the @WorldBank’s ‘Ease of Doing Business 2020’ report.  We’re 8th in the 🌍 and second in the G7 for our business environment, reinforcing our position as the number 1⃣ destination for foreign direct investment in Europe.

Some wonderful news this morning: We’ve agreed a deal to provide Orkambi and other lifesaving Cystic Fibrosis drugs on the NHS. Huge thanks to the many campaigners who have worked so hard, and to Vertex & the NHS. #OrkambiNow
https://t.co/6mM1YLL6EN

Another massive announcement on investment in science and research- we are investing £370m in 2,700 extra doctoral places in biosciences and AI, announcing 14 new AI doctoral training centres & our first Turing Fellows. A ‘people first’ research strategy: https://t.co/uoxi735E55
Excellent news and just the part of the improvement in facilities and services in #worcestershire https://t.co/reouaBKPfe
@jamespearson88 @WalkerWorcester A single sub 2 hour service a day will be a great benefit for local economy? Mmmmh!

#OnThisDay in 1707, the first Parliament of Great Britain met following Acts of Union passed in the English and Scottish Parliaments 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿🇬🇧

The Act from the English Parliament is now in @UKParlArchives. https://t.co/sB3d048YGs
@WalkerWorcester @GWRHelp @HuddlestonNigel @PeterJLuff Great news. I know you’ve been working on this for years and it will be hugely beneficial for our city. Well done Robin @WalkerWorcester 👏👏

Train journey times between Worcester and London will drop below 2hrs in Dec. Timetable changes will see sub-2hr journeys between Shrub Hill and Paddington on 06:43 service and on 17:43 service the other way. @WalkerWorcester says it'll be a great benefit for local economy. https://t.co/uDiQ6L7nym

@theandrewe has also pointed out that two early morning trains from Hereford to London now do the trip in under three hours, AND three return journeys (that’s nearly half hour quicker). Boost for the two counties, flippin’ marvellous. https://t.co/O9XR5TiNO9

It’ll apply to two of the busiest services - the 6.43am from Shrub Hill to London Paddington, and the 5.34pm back. @WalkerWorcester says it’ll encourage more inward investment, and that getting it under two hours removes a crucial psychological barrier” for businesses. https://t.co/JIG1a3gjRz

It’s a campaign that has lasted decades, but in December train times between Worcester and London WILL finally take under two hours - @GWRHelp has agreed to shave around 12 minutes off journey times. Big psychological boost for the city - more details on @bbchw. https://t.co/idLvnWSX2Y

Historic buildings enrich our lives and communities.

Today I launched the most ambitious #heritage preservation campaign for 40 years - to complete the listing process, beginning in 10 English counties. https://t.co/H1VcHWr7xk

blimey. I might have to try one of them again for the first time in a decade. I still find it quicker, cheaper and easier to drive to Warwick Parkway and use the excellent @chilternrailway https://t.co/TmpoVSQOj8
@WalkerWorcester This is from 15 December which is the date of our timetable change, the fastest London to Worcester train will be the 17:34 at 1 hour 59 minutes. -Andy

@WalkerWorcester Services between Worcester and London will become hourly, with some trains running fast between Oxford and London - the 06:43 weekday train from Worcester to London will make the Shrub Hill to London stretch in 1hr 57mins! #AllChange2019

A new, super-fast third hourly South Wales - London train will run at peak times non-stop between Bristol Parkway and Paddington from 15 December. This will connect the two Capitals in one hour 42 minutes, a full 17 minutes faster than what is possible today. #AllChange2019 https://t.co/Pyi1QoufUr
Boris’s new Brexit deal passed Parliament tonight. It is the first deal to pass Parliament since the referendum. But then Jeremy Corbyn and Labour voted to delay it. https://t.co/Ag9x3pSGnA

This is such an important story. When I was a kid the growing hole in the Ozone layer was a scary threat. 
The story of how we reversed the damage shows how with the right actions we can protect and renew our environment. In the coming years we can do the same with climate change https://t.co/bQ60Tqu3Z3

After 3 yrs, tonight @HouseofCommons voted x party for a Brexit deal - as agreed with the EU27. 
Huge credit to the 19 Labour + 25 Independent #MPs who agreed to abide by democratic decision of British people. Not there yet but tonight was real progress #WithdrawalAgreementBill

Parliament tonight should vote for the second reading of the Withdrawal Bill. 
It’s important to move forward and ensure we leave the EU with a deal. #BackTheDeal

MPs have voted 329 to 299 to approve the second reading of the European Union (Withdrawal Agreement) Bill.

There will now be a vote on a programme motion to timetable the remaining Commons stages of the Bill.

#WithdrawalAgreementBill https://t.co/nxJ7lkRx26

https://t.co/0sJ4tRqs5R https://t.co/OgxxTp8Z3m
Now that parliament has failed to better the @theresa_may deal. Let’s all vote for the deal and get on with #brexit
Now, please, can we all just vote for the deal and deliver Brexit
@WalkerWorcester - you voted against all options on the ballot tonight, does that mean you support a No-Deal exit now?

In 2015, we introduced the #NationalLivingWage to help the lowest earners 📝🔒

📆 Today, its biggest ever increase comes into effect – boosting the incomes of 1.8 million people by £690 a year 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦🌳 https://t.co/4zlhRjMyUH

Today the #NationalLivingWage is going up ↗️

🔵 Rising to £8.21 an hour.
🔵 That means 1.8 million people will be £690 better off this year.
🔵 That means full-time workers will be £2,750 better off than in 2015. https://t.co/1ZwpQkgU6T

Very pleased to see an inflation-busting hike in the National Living Wage today. The lowest paid in #UK now earning £8.21 an hour, up 38% from 2010. And of course the first £12,500 is tax free, almost double what  @UKLabour allowed. And a record # of jobs out there. https://t.co/DMQvrY7LbW

Our EU Settlement Scheme officially launches tomorrow. My message to EU citizens living here is clear - deal or no deal, we want you to stay 
https://t.co/qhZRykjJHx

I agree with @NSoames. We need to #BacktheDeal - none of the alternative options are possible without @HouseofCommons voting for the #WithdrawalAgreement ... the political declaration depends on the Deal passing https://t.co/6NQT0qqrIU
History will show that was the Prime Minister’s Deal that  honours the Referendum result and best protects the Economic and Security interests of U.K. and Europe #getitdone

Stats just out show: 

▶️ 920,000 new school places have been created since 2010 📈
▶️ (following a net loss of 100,000 between 2004-10 📉)
▶️ no. of children in over capacity school has almost halved vs 2010

Well on course for 1️⃣m new places this decade.

🏫 The biggest expansion in school places in two generations 🏫

↗️ The stats out today show we're well on track to create 1 million places this decade ↗️

With standards rising in our schools, this will mean more families have the choice of a good school place 🌳 https://t.co/KJ2U5XvhDq
